result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrinia Darlene Rivard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Count 1 and 16CF138.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive in the event Probation is revoked.
Court notes NO credit.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$737.36 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF544.
$939.32 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF544.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF544.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF544.

-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Random and regular testing.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Any other treatment recommended by Agent.
-Defendant to maintain all mental health treatment.
-Participate in MRT if Agent believes it is appropriate.
-State has 20 additional days to determine additional restitution with 10 additional days extended to Atty Caton to respond.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Katrinia Darlene Rivard appeares from jail. Case called at Includes 15CF544, 16CF138. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Katrinia Darlene Rivard appeared from jail. Court informs def of charges on 16CF138, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. State has filed an amended complaint and information adding a repeater.  ADA Minser updates the court. Atty. Caton responds. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF544 acknowledging the repeater. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3  in 15CF544. On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF544 and reads in and dismisses 16CF138. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
2 years probation concurrent  with conditions:
   Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
   Court notes NO credit.
- AODA and any recommended follow through
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Restitution of $1676.68
- Costs on both counts of $486.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
- Random and regular testing.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Any other treatment recommended by the agent. 
- DE to maintain all mental health treatment.
- If agent believes appropriate DE to participate in MRT. 

Court revokes bond and DE is remanded.

State has 20 additional days to determine additional restitution with 10 additional days extended to Atty. Caton to respond.

Preliminary hearing at 01-07-2016 08:15 am

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kevin R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: CAR for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Katrinia Darlene Rivard appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.
